Event.0: BC Marcus Tullius Cicero, Roman orator and politician is assassinated in Formiae
Event.1: Ballon d'Or: Real Madrid forward Cristiano Ronaldo wins his 5th award to equal Lionel Messi's record; 2nd consecutive win for Ronaldo
Event.2: Afghan politician Hamid Karzai was sworn in as Afghanistan's first popularly elected president.
Event.3: American rock band The Grateful Dead break up
Event.4: An earthquake struck northwestern Armenia, devastating numerous cities, including Vanadzor and Gyumri.
Event.5: PLO delegation lead by Yasser Arafat proclaims the State of Palestine, recognizing the existence of the State of Israel for the first time
Event.6: 6.9 earthquake in Spitak, Armenia kills 25,000-50,000 people and leaves up to 500,000 homeless
Event.7: "Star Trek: The Motion Picture" first movie of the series premieres directed by Robert Wise, starring William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy
Event.8: Shortly after declaring its independence, East Timor was invaded and occupied by Indonesian forces.
Event.9: American astronaut Eugene Andrew Cernan commanded the last manned flight to the Moon, effectively ending the Apollo program.
Event.10: Pope Paul VI & Orthodox Patriarch Athenagoras I simultaneously lift mutual excommunications that led to split of 2 churches in 1054
Event.11: American basketball player Larry Bird, who is considered one of the greatest pure shooters of all time, was born.
Event.12:
Larry Bird
American basketball player and coach
was born
Event.13:
Tom Waits
American singer-songwriter
was born
Event.14:
Pearl Harbor attack
On this day in 1941, Japanese bombers launched a surprise aerial attack on the U.S. naval base at Pearl Harbor on the island of Oahu, Hawaii, precipitating the entry of the United States into World War II.
Event.15: Imperial Japanese Navy with 353 planes attack US fleet at Pearl Harbor Naval Base, Hawaii, killing 2,403 people
Event.16: Adolf Hitler issued his Night and Fog Decree, a secret order for the arrest and execution of “persons endangering German security.”
Event.17: Mexican painters Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo remarry in San Francisco (divorced 1939)
Event.18:
Ellen Burstyn
American actress
was born
Event.19: Nizari Imam Aga Khan III (52) weds Andrée Joséphine Carron in Aix-les-Bains, France
Event.20:
Noam Chomsky
American linguist
was born
Event.21: The United States declared war on the Austro-Hungarian Empire during World War I.
Event.22:
Eli Wallach
American actor
was born
Event.23: Inventor Leo Baekeland patents the first thermo-setting plastic, Bakelite, sparking the birth of the plastics industry
Event.24: Delaware became the first state to ratify the U.S. Constitution.
Event.25: Princess Louise Henriette (19) of Nassau marries Frederick Henry Elector of Brandenburg
